page.title: 10Abbots Close Farm.
page.content: Abbots Close Farm is about 200 acres, it is owned by Mr.Tempest,who is helped by his son Stephen.The Tempest family have owned this farm since 1958.They keep sheep and cattle for meat to sell,as well as two horses, hens and dogs.The dogs are kept to guard the house,the hens for their eggs.The farm is divided into three parts,the roads which divide them are the A68 and the A698 to Wolsingham. The type of farming is mixed.The corn they grow is used for the cattle to eat.The coal board used one of the large fields to the North East of the farm for Open Cast working but have completed the work and restored the field to normal farm use. There is supposed to be an underground passage from the farmhouse to Harperley Hall.It has never been found but there is a cellar which is sealed
